page.title: 14TRANSPORT IN BRYNNA
page.content:
There are two main means of transport in Brynna, buses+cars.The bus companys are "National Welsh+Bebb".We found that most people have privately owned cars.Most ofthe roads in Brynna are tarred and are quite clean.Lots of children walk to school,and people walk to the shops.Children in Comprehesive have a bus to take them to school in Pencoed about 5 miles away.Over the mountain area there are tracks, which have got tar on them,they are quite narrow for cars,but impassible for buses.
by
{ RICHARD BROOK { AND {DARREN SMITH
